title: 103_hr2307
content: The Act titled "Workers' Political Rights Act" limits contributions and expenditures by labor organizations. The "Workers' Political Rights Act" limits contributions and expenditures by labor organizations. Amendments to the Federal Election Campaign Act include requirements for labor organizations to provide written notification to employees regarding political activities. The "Workers' Political Rights Act" requires labor organizations to inform employees that they cannot be forced to pay for the organization's political activities. Employees cannot be required to join a labor organization, but can choose to pay an agency fee instead. The fee is limited to the cost of exclusive representation services for the employee's collective bargaining unit. The agency fee for employees is limited to the cost of exclusive representation services for their collective bargaining unit. Full members can receive a reduction in dues for political activities based on the organization's spending from the previous fiscal year. Membership dues, initiation fees, and assessments for the current year are also disclosed. The labor organization must provide an annual examination by an independent certified public accountant of financial statements to verify expenditures for political activities and agency fees. Additionally, the organization must maintain procedures to determine costs chargeable to agency fee payors for exclusive representation services. The labor organization must maintain procedures to determine costs chargeable to agency fee payors for exclusive representation services. If challenged, an impartial decisionmaker will hear and decide on the costs, with disputed amounts placed in escrow. Labor organizations failing to meet requirements must finance specified expenditures with funds collected under the Act for their separate segregated fund. Labor organizations failing to meet requirements must finance specified expenditures with funds collected under the Act for their separate segregated fund, only using legally collected funds for their separate segregated fund for expenditures specified in subparagraphs (A), (B), or (C) of paragraph (2). Subparagraph (A) of paragraph (2) applies only to communications advocating the election or defeat of a clearly identified candidate for elective public office. The amendments made by section 2 of the Act apply to contributions and expenditures made after the enactment date.
